original_definition: 'heat generator' means the part of a water heater that generates the heat using one or more of the following processes:combustion of fossil fuels and/or biomass fuels;use of the Joule effect in electric resistance heating elements;capture of ambient heat from an air source, water source or ground source, and/or waste heat;whereby a heat generator designed for a water heater and a water heater housing to be equipped with such a heat generator shall be also considered a water heater;
generated_definition: 'heat generator' means a device designed to generate heat, typically used in water heaters and storage water heaters, and tested separately or in combination with other components such as solar collectors, solar hot water storage tanks, and pumps.
